principle1.name: Single Source of Truth
principle1.concept: Information dispersion equals context confusion; both AI and humans may misjudge.
practices: Centralize all requirements, designs, and context in one documentation hub (Notion / Confluence / GitHub Wiki)
For AI, directly reference this single source rather than ad-hoc copy-pasting
antiPatterns: Team members maintaining different document versions, causing inconsistent AI responses

principle2.name: Prompt First
principle2.concept: Prompts are the new generation of design documents.
practices: Write prompts before tasks begin, clarifying inputs, outputs, style, and constraints
Teams reuse validated prompt templates
antiPatterns: Immediately asking AI to write code, resulting in wrong direction and rework

principle1.name: Single Source of Truth
principle1.concept: Information dispersion equals context confusion; both AI and humans may misjudge.
practices: Centralize all requirements, designs, and context in one documentation hub (Notion / Confluence / GitHub Wiki)
For AI, directly reference this single source rather than ad-hoc copy-pasting
antiPatterns: Team members maintaining different document versions, causing inconsistent AI responses

principle2.name: Prompt First
principle2.concept: Prompts are the new generation of design documents.
practices: Write prompts before tasks begin, clarifying inputs, outputs, style, and constraints
Teams reuse validated prompt templates
antiPatterns: Immediately asking AI to write code, resulting in wrong direction and rework

principle3.name: Context Hygiene
principle3.concept: Clean context enables more precise AI performance.
practices: Start independent sessions for each new task to avoid old content interference
Regularly summarize current status in one sentence to help AI "align context"
antiPatterns: Mixing conversations from three days ago with today's tasks

principle4.name: Human-in-the-Loop
principle4.concept: AI produces quickly, but only humans can grasp direction and business judgment.
practices: AI provides drafts, humans handle key decisions and risk management
Perform logic validation for important features before merging code
antiPatterns: Accepting AI output wholesale without any review

principle5.name: Chunked Work
principle5.concept: Break large tasks into small chunks for easier iteration and correction.
practices: Control tasks to small scope completable in 10-30 minutes
Immediately validate results after each chunk
antiPatterns: Having AI write 5000 lines at once, making debugging impossible

principle6.name: Parallel Flow
principle6.concept: While AI works, humans do low-switching-cost side tasks to maintain continuous rhythm.
practices: Prepare a "side task list" including documentation, small fixes, code reviews
When waiting for AI, avoid high cognitive load tasks to prevent switching overhead
antiPatterns: Browsing social media while waiting for AI, breaking rhythm

principle7.name: Cognitive Load Budget
principle7.concept: Human attention is a scarce resource.
practices: Set daily time limits for AI collaboration
Schedule deep review tasks during peak mental hours
antiPatterns: Working with AI all day long, becoming completely exhausted by evening

principle8.name: Flow Protection
principle8.concept: Once high-focus flow is interrupted, recovery cost is extremely high.
practices: Set focused time blocks (e.g., 90 minutes), blocking notifications and interruptions
Batch AI interactions within focus flow rather than scattered triggers
antiPatterns: Coding while replying to WeChat and reading AI output, causing cliff-like efficiency drop

principle9.name: Reproducible Sessions
principle9.concept: Collaborative processes must be traceable to enable continuous optimization.
practices: Save prompts, AI versions, and change reasons to code or knowledge base
Can replay generation process when bugs occur
antiPatterns: No record of AI generation history, unable to trace error causes

principle10.name: Rest & Reflection
practices: Spend 5 minutes after sprint reviewing AI output vs expectations
Update prompt templates and accumulate "pitfall records"
antiPatterns: Continuous sprinting without summarizing accumulated errors

principle11.name: Skill Parity
principle11.concept: AI is a magnifying glass that amplifies both abilities and shortcomings.
practices: Continuously learn domain knowledge and code review skills
Maintain independent judgment ability for AI output
antiPatterns: Complete dependency on AI, losing manual abilities and technical insights

principle12.name: Culture of Curiosity
principle12.concept: Curiosity drives exploration and prevents "blind faith in AI".
practices: When facing AI answers, first ask "why", then ask "can it be better"
Team shares AI usage experiences and improvement ideas
antiPatterns: Accepting AI solutions wholesale without ever questioning

fundamentals.title: Fundamentals Course
fundamentals.theory: Comprehensive step-by-step guide to mastering Claude's best prompt engineering practices. Learn three core skills: API structure, clear communication, and role assignment.

chapter1.title: Chapter 1: Basic Prompt Structure
chapter1.theory: Learn the required parameters of the Messages API: model, max_tokens, messages array. Master the user/assistant conversation format and correct usage of system prompts.
examples: ✅ Correct format: {role: 'user', content: 'Hi Claude, how are you?'}
❌ Wrong format: {Hi Claude, how are you?} - missing role and content fields
✅ System prompt: 'You are a logical reasoning expert who specializes in solving complex logical problems'

countToThree.instructions: Use the correct user/assistant format to have Claude count to three
hints: State your request directly
Use simple clear instructions
Avoid unnecessary complexity

systemPromptChild.instructions: Modify the SYSTEM_PROMPT to make Claude respond like a 3-year-old child
hints: Think about how 3-year-olds speak
Use simple vocabulary and expressions
Add childlike language features

chapter2.title: Chapter 2: Being Clear and Direct
chapter2.theory: Claude needs clear instructions. Follow the golden rule: if you show your prompt to a colleague and they're confused, Claude will be confused too.
examples: ✅ Clear: 'Write a haiku about robots, skip the preamble and go straight to the poem'
❌ Vague: 'Who is the best basketball player of all time?'
✅ Force choice: 'Who is the best basketball player of all time? While there are different opinions, if you had to choose one, who would it be?'

spanishResponse.instructions: Modify the SYSTEM_PROMPT to make Claude respond in Spanish
hints: Tell Claude directly which language to use
You can specify language requirements in the system prompt

onePlayerOnly.instructions: Have Claude respond with only one player's name, no other text or punctuation
hints: Be very specific about format requirements
Clearly state no explanations or other content
Force Claude to make a choice
Clearly specify story length
You can provide specific story themes
Request detailed descriptions and plot development

chapter3.title: Chapter 3: Assigning Roles (Role Prompting)
chapter3.theory: Assigning specific roles to Claude can significantly improve performance. Role setting can change response style, tone, and level of expertise.
examples: ✅ Cat role: system='You are a cat' → will answer from a cat's perspective
❌ Logic error: Jack looks at Anne, Anne looks at George, Jack is married George is unmarried, is a married person looking at an unmarried person?
✅ Logic expert: system='You are a logical reasoning expert' → correctly analyzes this problem

mathCorrection.instructions: Have Claude find the math error: 2x-3=9, 2x=6, x=3
mathCorrection.template:
Is this equation solved correctly?

2x - 3 = 9
2x = 6
x = 3
hints: Assign Claude a math teacher or logic expert role
Request careful checking of each step
Emphasize finding the error

advanced.title: Advanced Course
advanced.theory: Advanced prompt engineering techniques: Data Separation, Output Formatting, and Chain-of-Thought Reasoning. These methods unlock Claude's full analytical potential.

dataSeparation.title: Data Separation Techniques
dataSeparation.theory: Use XML tags, Markdown sections, or clear delimiters to separate data from instructions. This prevents confusion and improves processing accuracy.
examples: Mixed: 'Summarize this: AI is transforming industries by automating tasks'

Separated: 'Analyze the following text:

<content>
AI is transforming industries
</content>

Provide a 2-sentence summary.'

adv1.instructions: Use XML tags to separate data when analyzing text structure
adv1.template:
Analyze the grammar of this sentence:

<sentence>
[Your sentence]
</sentence>
hints: Use clear XML delimiters
Keep instructions separate from data
Be specific about analysis type

outputFormatting.title: Output Formatting Control
outputFormatting.theory: Control Claude's response format through clear templates, examples, and structural requirements. Consistent formatting enables automation and integration.
examples: Formatted: 'List 3 languages using this format:\n1. **Language**: Description\n2. **Language**: Description'

adv2.instructions: Get Claude to provide exactly 3 items in a specific numbered format
adv2.template: Give me 3 productivity tips in this exact format:\n[Define your format]
hints: Specify exact formatting requirements
Use templates as examples
Be explicit about structure

chainOfThought.title: Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
chainOfThought.theory: Unlock Claude's analytical capabilities by requiring step-by-step reasoning. This technique significantly improves complex problem solving and ensures logical transparency.
examples: Chain-of-thought: 'Calculate 25% of 80. Show each step of your calculation with explanations.'

adv3.instructions: Get Claude to solve a complex problem using explicit step-by-step reasoning
adv3.template: Solve this step by step, showing your work: [Your problem]
hints: Ask for explicit reasoning
Request step-by-step breakdown
Look for logical connectors
